titlestmt.titleproper: Jean P. Vasco and Joseph Pachia political essays 1829
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Jean P. Vasco and Joseph Pachia political essays

scopecontent.p: The volume includes two monographs. Jean P. Vasco's "A Political Essay on Money," discusses the value of money, taxes on importing or exporting money, relations between different currencies, the effect of monopolies, and other topics. Joseph Pachia's "A History of Political Economy in Italy" (1829), explores the economic history of various Italian states as well as the works of Italian political economists including Pasparo Scaruffi, Bernardo Davarzati, Gian Donato Turbolo, and several others.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.
